title: Trondheim Business School
text:
Trondheim Business School () or HHiT, former a <a href="faculty%20%28university%29">faculty</a> of <a href="S%C3%B8r-Tr%C3%B8ndelag%20University%20College">Sør-Trøndelag University College</a> (HiST) in <a href="Trondheim">Trondheim</a>, <a href="Norway">Norway</a>, is, as of 2016, a faculty of <a href="Norwegian%20University%20of%20Science%20and%20Technology">Norwegian University of Science and Technology</a>. The school provides <a href="economics">economics</a> and <a href="business">business management</a> education. It was founded in 1967 as an independent <a href="university%20college">university college</a>, but in 1994 it and seven other university colleges in Trondheim merged to form HiST. From the merger until 2003 the school was called Sør-Trøndelag University College, Faculty of Economics and Administration.
The school is located at <a href="Elgeseter">Elgeseter</a>, in a building that was officially opened in 2014.
The school has about 1200 students, including 150 <a href="postgraduate">postgraduate</a> and a few <a href="Doctor%20of%20Philosophy">doctoral students</a>. The school only offers one <a href="bachelor%20degree">bachelor degree</a>, in <a href="Business">business administration</a>, but with possibilities to specialise in <a href="finance">finance</a>, <a href="accounting">accounting</a>, <a href="marketing">marketing</a>, <a href="management">management</a>, <a href="sport%20management">sport management</a> and <a href="auditor">audition</a>. There is also possibility to get a <a href="Master%20of%20Science">Master of Science</a> in Business Administration with specialisation in finance, management or marketing.
